sen.j: 岩屋寺（いわやじ）は、京都府京都市山科区にある曹洞宗の寺院。
sen.e: Iwaya-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Iwaya-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Iwaya-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple belonging to the Soto Sect located in Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix is) Shinyuzan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix is) Shinyuzan.
Its sango (honorific mountain prefix is) Mt. Shinyu.
The principal image is Fudo Myoo.
The principal image is Fudo Myoo.
The principal image is Fudo Myoo.

sen.j: 大石内蔵助が隠棲したところと伝えられ、大石寺とも称される。
sen.e: The temple is reputed to be where Kuranosuke OISHI retired and is also known as Taiseki-ji Temple.
The temple is reputed to be where Kuranosuke OISHI retired and is also known as Taiseki-ji Temple.
The temple is reputed to be where Kuranosuke OISHI retired and is also known as Taiseki-ji Temple.
History
History
History

sen.j: この寺の創建年代等については不詳であるが、古くは天台宗に属していた。
sen.e: Details surrounding the founding of Iwaya-ji Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but in ancient times it belonged to the Tendai Sect.
Details surrounding the founding of Iwaya-ji Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but in ancient times it belonged to the Tendai Sect.
Details surrounding the founding of Iwaya-ji Temple including the year in which it was established are unknown but in ancient times it belonged to the Tendai Sect.
